arts.ttl: Serie A | Udinese 3-2 Venezia: Match Report
arts.sum: In a pulsating Serie A encounter, Udinese emerged victorious with a 3-2 win over Venezia in a match that showcased the beautiful unpredictability of football. The game was a rollercoaster of emotions, with Udinese initially racing to a 2-0 lead before Venezia mounted a spirited comeback to level the scores, only for the home side to snatch a late winner. arts.ttl: Serie A | Udinese v Venezia: Probable starting lineups
arts.sum: Udinese manager Kosta Runjaic faces significant selection challenges as his team prepares to host Venezia in Serie A on Saturday afternoon. The Friulian side will be without several key players due to injuries and suspension. The post Serie A | Udinese v Venezia: Probable starting lineups appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Udinese-Venezia: aiming to return to winning ways
arts.sum: Udinese are unbeaten in their five home games against Venezia in Serie A, winning the most recent three (D2); in general, only against Como (10), Piacenza (eight) and Novara (six) have the Friulians played more home matches without ever losing in the competition. Udinese could become only the third opponent against which Venezia have won both seasonal Serie A matches in the post-war period, after Bologna in 2021/22 and Cagliari in 1998/99.

arts.ttl: Runjaic Demands Fiery Start from Udinese Against Venezia
arts.sum: Udinese manager Kosta Runjaic emphasized the need for his team to show passion and intensity from the opening whistle in their upcoming Serie A match against Venezia. Speaking at a pre-match press conference, Runjaic outlined his expectations for Saturday's crucial encounter at the Bluenergy Stadium. arts.ttl: Serie A | Udinese v Venezia: Match Preview
arts.sum: The Stadio Friuli is set to host a crucial Serie A encounter this Saturday as Udinese welcome Venezia in a match that could have significant implications for both teams' seasons. Udinese, currently languishing in the bottom half of the table, are desperate to halt their recent slide, while Venezia continue their fight against relegation. arts.ttl: Wolves express interest in Udinese defender as they look set to miss out on Lens centre-back Kevin Danso
arts.sum: SIMON JONES: Wolves made two bids for Danso but were unable to agree a fee with Lens for the 26-year-old. The Ligue 1 side are demanding a fee of £26m for Danso, who is also wanted by Rennes.
